name: 鄭瑞清
objective:
The purpose of this course is to provide the theoretical background for graduate students majoring in antennas, microwave circuits and electromagnetic waves. The contents include the following topics: 
1.　　Fundamental Theories
2.　　Green's functions
3.　　Plane wave functions
4.　　Cylindrical wave functions
5.　　Spherical wave functions
6.　　Perturbation thoery
7.　　Variation thorey 
8.　　Microwave networks
schedule:
1.　　Introduction to waves 
2.　　Fundamental theories I
3.　　Fundamental theories II
4.　　Green's functions and integral equations 
5.　　Plane wave functions 
6.　　Rectangular waveguides and cavities 
7.　　Dielectric-slab waveguides 
8.　　Modal expansions of fields
9.　　Midterm exam
10.　　Circular wave functions
11.　　Circular waveguides and cavities 
12.　　Spherical wave functions
13.　　Radial waveguides and spherical cavities 
14.　　Perturbation theory
15.　　Variation theory
16.　　Network concept 
17.　　One- and two-port networks
18.　　Final exam
materials:
Textbook: Harrington, "Time-harmonic electromagnetic fields," Wiley-IEEE Press, 2001.
Reference: 
1. Ramo, Whinnery, Duzer, "Fields and Waves in Communication Electronics, 3rd. Ed."
2. Caloz, Itoh, "Electromagnetic Metamaterials: Transmission Line Theory and Microwave Applications."
